Detailed Description

Type traits for SkipListSet class.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef cds::backoff::Default cds::container::skip_list::type_traits::back_off

back-off strategy used

If the option is not specified, the cds::backoff::Default is used.

typedef opt::none cds::container::skip_list::type_traits::compare

Key comparison functor.

No default functor is provided. If the option is not specified, the less is used.

typedef atomicity::empty_item_counter cds::container::skip_list::type_traits::item_counter

Item counter.

The type for item counting feature. Default is no item counter (atomicity::empty_item_counter)

typedef opt::none cds::container::skip_list::type_traits::less

specifies binary predicate used for key compare.

Default is std::less<T>.

typedef opt::v::relaxed_ordering cds::container::skip_list::type_traits::memory_model

C++ memory ordering model.

List of available memory ordering see opt::memory_model

typedef turbo_pascal cds::container::skip_list::type_traits::random_level_generator

Random level generator.

The random level generator is an important part of skip-list algorithm. The node height in the skip-list have a probabilistic distribution where half of the nodes that have level i also have level i+1 (i = 0..30). The height of a node is in range [0..31].

See skip_list::random_level_generator option setter.

typedef opt::v::rcu_throw_deadlock cds::container::skip_list::type_traits::rcu_check_deadlock

RCU deadlock checking policy (for RCU-based SkipListSet)

List of available options see opt::rcu_check_deadlock
